name: Ebi Chili
author: Pearl Ishizaki
summary: Ebi chili is one of those Japanese dishes which has Chinese influence. It is a shrimp or prawn dish with a sweet and spicy sauce. It's an easy recipe and a favorite bento ingredient for many kids. For this dish I've used fresh prawns, which needed to be cleaned well before cooking. In this recipe, the cooking time is only 3 minutes which makes it a perfect go-to recipe in case of kitchen emergencies.
ingredients: 3 leaves green lettuce, torn into bite-sized pieces
directions: Combine shrimp, water, 1 tablespoon cornstarch, and 1/2 teaspoon salt in a microwave-safe bowl; mix well with your hands
Pat shrimp dry with paper towels; return to the bowl
Whisk ketchup, chili bean paste, sake, vinegar, sugar, 1 teaspoon cornstarch, and 1/4 teaspoon salt together in a bowl
Mix in scallion, garlic, and ginger
Pour ketchup mixture evenly over the shrimp
Cover bowl with microwave-safe plastic wrap
Microwave on 600W power until shrimp turn opaque, about 3 minutes
Spread lettuce pieces on a serving plate; pour shrimp on top
